com.iota.iri.utils.log.interval

Class IntervalProgressLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iota.iri.utils.log.interval.IntervalProgressLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProgressLogger

    public class IntervalProgressLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProgressLogger
    Implements the basic contract of the ProgressLogger while showing the progress as messages in the console. Instead of printing all messages immediately and unnecessarily spamming the console output, it rate limits the amount of messages shown and only prints updates in a pre-defined interval.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntervalProgressLogger(java.lang.String taskName, java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
      Does the same as IntervalProgressLogger(String, Class, int) but defaults to DEFAULT_LOG_INTERVAL for the interval.
      IntervalProgressLogger(java.lang.String taskName, java.lang.Class<?> clazz, int logInterval)
      Creates a ProgressLogger that shows its progress in a pre-defined interval.
      IntervalProgressLogger(java.lang.String taskName, org.slf4j.Logger logger)
      Does the same as IntervalProgressLogger(String, Logger, int) but defaults to DEFAULT_LOG_INTERVAL for the interval.
      IntervalProgressLogger(java.lang.String taskName, org.slf4j.Logger logger, int logInterval)
      Creates a ProgressLogger that shows its progress in a pre-defined interval.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntervalProgressLogger

        public IntervalProgressLogger(java.lang.String taskName,
                              java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Does the same as IntervalProgressLogger(String, Class, int) but defaults to DEFAULT_LOG_INTERVAL for the interval.
        Parameters:
        taskName - name of the task that shall be shown on the screen
        clazz - class that is used to identify the origin of the log messages

      • IntervalProgressLogger

        public IntervalProgressLogger(java.lang.String taskName,
                              org.slf4j.Logger logger)
        Does the same as IntervalProgressLogger(String, Logger, int) but defaults to DEFAULT_LOG_INTERVAL for the interval.
        Parameters:
        taskName - name of the task that shall be shown on the screen
        logger - logback logger for issuing the messages

      • IntervalProgressLogger

        public IntervalProgressLogger(java.lang.String taskName,
                              java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                              int logInterval)
        Creates a ProgressLogger that shows its progress in a pre-defined interval.
        Parameters:
        taskName - name of the task that shall be shown on the screen
        clazz - class that is used to identify the origin of the log messages
        logInterval - the time in milliseconds between consecutive log messages

      • IntervalProgressLogger

        Parameters:

        logger - logback logger for issuing the messages
        logInterval - the time in milliseconds between consecutive log messages

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public IntervalProgressLogger start()
        Starts the logging by (re)setting the current step to 0 and trigger the output of the current progress.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ProgressLogger
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • start

        public IntervalProgressLogger start(int stepCount)
        Does the same as ProgressLogger.start() but sets the expected step count to the given value. This allows us to initialize and start the logging in a single call.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ProgressLogger
        Parameters:
        stepCount - number of steps that the task involves
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • progress

        public IntervalProgressLogger progress()
        Increases the current step by one and triggers the output of the current progress. This should be called whenever we finish a sub task.
        Specified by:
        progress in interface ProgressLogger
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • progress

        public IntervalProgressLogger progress(int currentStep)
        Sets the current step to the given value and triggers the output of the current progress.
        Specified by:
        progress in interface ProgressLogger
        Parameters:
        currentStep - the current step that was just finished
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • finish

        public IntervalProgressLogger finish()
        Sets the current step to the expected step count and triggers the output of the current progress. This allows us to dump the progress when the processing of the task succeeds. It will show the message immediately instead of waiting for the interval to pass.
        Specified by:
        finish in interface ProgressLogger
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • abort

        public IntervalProgressLogger abort()
        Marks the task as failed and triggers the output of a status message informing us about the failure. It will show the message immediately instead of waiting for the interval to pass.
        Specified by:
        abort in interface ProgressLogger
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • abort

        public IntervalProgressLogger abort(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Marks the task as failed and triggers the output of a status message informing us about the failure. The shown error message will contain the reason for the error given by the passed in Exception. It will show the message immediately instead of waiting for the interval to pass.
        Specified by:
        abort in interface ProgressLogger
        Parameters:
        cause - reason for the failure
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • getEnabled

        public boolean getEnabled()
        This method is the getter for the enabled flag of the logger. If the logger is disabled it will simply omit showing log messages.
        Specified by:
        getEnabled in interface ProgressLogger
        Returns:
        true if the logger shall output messages and false otherwise (the logger is enabled by default)

      • setEnabled

        public IntervalProgressLogger setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        This method is the setter for the enabled flag of the logger. If the logger is disabled it will simply omit showing log messages.
        Specified by:
        setEnabled in interface ProgressLogger
        Parameters:
